note.p: Gardener. Apprenticed to his father, Stephen Barnes, head gardener at Eashing House, Godalming, Surrey, 1814–18; to Mr Moore, King’s Road, London, 1818–22. Gardener to Mr Stone of Peckham; superintendent of the forcing department for a market gardener at Bermondsey; then superintendent in charge of forty acres of market garden at Greenwich. Head gardener, Cranford House, Essex, 1831–4; at Chiselhurst, Kent, 1834–9; at Bicton, near Budleigh Salterton, Devon, 1839–69. A skilled cultivator and manager.
